snippet: Consumer prices in Germany rose less than 1 percent in the last year, the most in the four largest countries in the eurozone.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column holds that a big part of Europe's inflation problem and economic malaise is that consumer prices and labor costs among Germany and other eurozone countries are out of balance.
lead_paragraph: Consumer prices in Germany rose less than 1 percent in the last year, the most in the four largest countries in the eurozone.

headline.print_headline: Where Prices Don’t Want to Rise
headline.main: Where Prices Don’t Want to Rise
